name: Portugal
takeaway: Portugal is a sui generis case-study regarding China: on the one hand, a plurisecular history and a good relationship regarding Macau and also its community living in Portugal, and, on the other hand, a greater convergence with the EU and US alignment regarding China as a "Partner, Competitor, and Systemic Rival" and "Strategic Competitor". In the words of the former Minister of Foreign Affairs: "China is a Partner, but not our Ally"

The economic relationship is flourishing and includes strategic assets such as China being the biggest stakeholder in the Portuguese Electric Grid Network, amongst other sensitive and important sectors of our economy. Meanwhile, a Strategic Partnership with a Close Dialogue maintained since 2019 is increasingly curtailed by national security considerations such as the exclusion from 5G networks of "companies that are not from NATO, EU or OECD member-states" and the EU Critical Raw Materials Act.
Domestically, the emphasis of Chinese influence has been mostly on culture and language rather than a main strategic spill-over into the relationship between the two states.

In 2024, two issues should remain under the spotlight that are a good barometer regarding the evolution of the bilateral relationship: the announcement of an ambitious investment regarding lithium electric batteries, and developments pertaining to Huawei's legal challege to its exclusion from 5G.
description-1: In 2023, Portugal had a GDP per capita of US$27,275 and a total population of 10.43 million people.
description-2: Portugal established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1979. Portugal was ranked 7th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 96/100.

Media.evidence: Some media organizations are mentioned in the World Chinese Media network but their operation seems to be more Portuguese versions of Chinese media or Macau related rather than Portuguese media truly operating in Portugal. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Most seem not to be really operational or very scarce in terms of news contents. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "insignificant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Lusa News Agency,Portugal, which is the Portuguese news agency, is a Council Member of Belt and Road News Network. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Since this is the main Portuguese News Agency the impact is considerable. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: In 2023, China organized a training course for press officials and journalists from Portuguese-speaking countries in Beijing. Thirty press officers and journalists from six Portuguese-speaking countries, including Portugal, among others, participated in the training course. The course included lectures, exchanges, seminars, cultural visits, and other travel activities. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few " rating. Nonetheless, the impact seems very limited. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: In 2023, China organized a training course for press officials and journalists from Portuguese-speaking countries in Beijing. Thirty press officers and journalists from six Portuguese-speaking countries, including Portugal, among others, participated in the training course. The course included  lectures, exchanges, seminars, cultural visits, and other  activities. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few " rating. Nonetheless, the impact seems limited. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.

Media.evidence: There are available on the internet Portuguese versions of PRC state-media such as People's Daily, Xinhua and CIR. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. These state-media channels do not have a major impact in the media environment in Portugal. Therefore, the indidcator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is greater cooperation between state-funded media and its Portuguese counterparts. For instance, there is a partnership for the production of documentarys between CCTV and RTP (portuguese state television); between CCTV and Lusa (Portuguese news agency) and between Lusa and People's Daily online. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. But in both cases it is not really significant from a point of view of impact or influence of PRC propaganda within the audiences of both media outlets. The same is true of a 29,35%  participation in Global Media Group (conglomerate of Radio (TSF) and Newspapers (Diario de Noticias and Jornal de Noticias) by Kevin Ho from Macau. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Insignificant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Parliamentary Joint Friendship Association exists for quite some time. One of the reasons is historical: the Portuguese presence in Macau. Notwithstanding, in the last years the very existence of this Group has been criticized by some political parties (see the first link). Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: During the COVID-19 pandemic China sent donations pertaining to medical supplies. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Nonetheless, this was an exceptional and one-off situation.Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Training Center of Forum Macao is inviting officials from Portuguese-speaking countries to come to Macao for training and exchange. Public administration, healthcare, public health, government management, and other topics are included in the courses. Trainees are also scheduled to tour China, engage in trade with China, assess the state of local development, and visit businesses, among other things.  In addition, five Portuguese Parliamentarians went to China to participate in a training course on international legal cooperation capacity building. Therefore, the indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. However, while all these actitvities are noteworthy they do not seem to have had a systemic impact. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Strategic Partnership was established in 2005. It was reinforced in 2018, alongside Xi Jinping's official visit to Portugal, with the signature of 17 cooperation agreements and a joint declaration. In 2018, an MoU was signed regarding the Belt and Road Initiative. In 2019, it was upgraded to a Strategic Dialogue alongside the Visit of the President of the Portuguese Republic to China. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.note: For other relevant historical dimensions particularly regarding Macau in the bilateral relationship see https://portaldiplomatico.mne.gov.pt/relacoesbilaterais/paises-geral/republica-popular-da-china
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Because of Macau's peculiar situation (Portuguese administrated until 1999, when it was returned to China, and then until 2049 which signifies the end de jure of the Portuguese Rule of Law/legal system (albeit de facto already heavily challenged)) and its Portuguese community and a history of plurisecular historical contacts, Portugal recognised the PRC's One China Policy. It is stated in the 2018 «Joint-Statement between the Portuguese Republic and the People’s Republic of China on the Reinforcement of the Global Strategic Partnership», article 4: “Portugal has reinforced the adherence to the principle of ‘One China’, as well as the support for the Chinese position on the question of Taiwan» . Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Portugal usually sides with the EU position on these matters (see EU statement). Notwithstanding, due to mostly the Portuguese community in Macau, the Portuguese government avoids being vocal about it individually. Therefore, the Index country has rejected the PRC’s territorial claim and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Portugal usually sides with the EU position or with its European counterparts (see link regarding UN Third Committee voiced by the United Kingdom and regarding a collective position of 51 member-states) in these matters. Notwithstanding, due to mostly the Portuguese community in Macau, the Portuguese government avoids being vocal about it individually. Therefore, the Index country has denounced the PRC’s treatment of its Uyghur population and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is a European position (Foreign Ministers) opposing the PRC regarding the treatment of its Tibetan population. The Assembly of the Portuguese Republic has also condemned the violence of the PRC towards the Tibetan population. Notwithstanding, due to mostly the Portuguese community in Macau, the Portuguese government avoids being vocal about it individually. Therefore, the Index country has denounced the PRC’s treatment of its Tibet population and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Portugal has sided with its European counterparts and, therefore, usually sides with the EU position. Notwithstanding, due to mostly the Portuguese community in Macau, the Portuguese government avoids being vocal about it individually. Therefore, the Index country has denounced the PRC’s  ongoing repression in Hong Kong, such as the imposition of the National Security Law  and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are several examples of partnerships between Universities and Chinese companies such as Huawei. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. These  partnerships are made with prestigious Portuguese Universities and are relevant also from a technology development point of view. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are several Confucius Institutes such as the ones at the University of Minho (2006), Lisbon (2008) or Coimbra (2016).  Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a Few" . This network is well established and has a cultural and language dimension that is relevant. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is a pilot project in several schools coordinated by the Minister of Education. The goal is to diversify the languages that a student can learn.This initiative seems to be in a initial or embryonic phase. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is one Think Tank that is called "Friends of the Belt and Road" that has the explicit goal of aggregating "People and institutions that believe that the project One Belt One Road in which the People's Republic of China structures its current diplomatic action will lead to a new globalisation dynamics that will change the world." On the other hand, Professor Alberto Dias got the “三秦友谊奖” belonging to the talent recruitment plan of the Shaanxi Province. Professor Luísa Bastos was selected into the High-Level Foreign Experts Recruitment Program of China’s the Ministry of Science and Technology, and also employed as a part-time distinguished professor at Shandong University. Portuguese linguist João Veloso assumes office as head of UM Department of Portuguese. Professor Jorge Eiras from the University of Porto, Portugal, was appointed as the "Foreign Expert Distinguished Researcher of the Chinese Academy of Sciences.” Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Taking into account the individual academics who have been making significant inroads or have been distinguished by Chinese research centers, their activities are significant. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: In my country, there has been some questions raised  as to financing of think tanks or the role in this regard of the Confucius Institutes, but these claims are not easy to confirm. Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are some cases such as the following ones: Professor Alberto Dias got the “三秦友谊奖” belonging to the talent recruitment plan of the Shaanxi Province; Professor Luísa Bastos was selected into the High-Level Foreign Experts Recruitment  Program of China’s the Ministry of Science and Technology, and also employed as a part-time distinguished professor at Shandong University; Portuguese linguist João Veloso assumes office as head of UM Department of Portuguese; and Professor Jorge Eiras from the University of Porto, Portugal, was appointed as the Foreign Expert Distinguished Researcher of the Chinese Academy of Sciences. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Moreover, the cases represent important and visible appointments. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.

Academia.evidence: In my country, there have been some questions raised regarding this issue, but these claims are not easy to confirm. For instance, the Macau Scientific Cultural Center, which is under a specific MoU between Portugal and China, has a very clear scientific dimension . Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Academia.note: There was an incident in 2014 involving the organisation of the European Association for Chinese Studies Conference in Braga. One of the sponsors was a Taiwanese entity and its inclusion in the programme was contested and slashed by the Chinese official who was a visitor to this conferenceand demanded that the sponsored page be removed. EACS was adamant that this was a violation of its freedom and, therefore, condemned the incident. It seems to have been an isolated case and, therefore, no need to change the negative answer to this Indicator.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is evidence of an MoU regarding cultural cooperation projects and tourism in 2019 signed between two cities, Porto, Portugal and Shanghai, China. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. However, this is still only an MoU and has hadd little impact. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In Portugal, there are several sister-cities (in portuguese "cidades geminadas") such as the cases of Castelo Branco and Zhuhai, Coimbra and Guangzhou, Oporto and Macau and Shenzhen or Lisbon and Macau. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a Few" rating. In terms of impact it seems just at a local level. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: The case of the signature of a MoU between the city of Oporto and the Chinese city of Shanghai  (were already twin cities) is noteworhty since it is Portugal's second biggest city. Therefore, the Indicator deserves a Few" rating. On the other hand, the main actitivies seem to be regarding tourism and culture. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Domestic Politics.note: There have been some cases of politicians or goverment employees having pad trips to China in the past. The most high-profile ones have been regarding Huawei and they pertain to 2015.

Economy.evidence: According to the Portuguese INE (National Institute of Statistics) in 2022 Portugal's main partner is Spain with 26% exports and 32,1% imports in goods. Therefore, there is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: We don't have any public indicator that acknowledges this. In 2019, with the goal of diversifying the investors in the sovereign debt Portugal issued "Panda Bonds". But ever since there hasn't been any movements in this regard. In 2019, this transaction was placed at 259 million Euros. Therefore, while the local experts have not observed the indicator phenomena, they cannot provide the necessary documentary evidence to answer the Indicator in the negative. Thefrefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: In my country, PRC-related entities substantially control critical infrastructures such as REN (National Electrical Grid) with 25% by China State Grid (being its the major shareholder) plus 5% by Fidelidade insurance, which it also controls. Moreover, it also is the biggest shareholder in EDP (Main Electricity Company) with 20,86% via China Three Gorges,  in BCP Millenium with 29,5% (one of the biggest private banks) by Fosun. In the banking sector two banks were bought are respectively held 100% by Haitong and Bison. Moreover, 84% of Fidelidade (one of the big insurance companies) also by Fosun and a big stake in the hospital sector with LuzSaúde. Therefore, this Indicator deserves s "Yes" response.
Economy.note:
1. All this data pertains to 31 December 2023 
2. One of the first books on China's active policy of buying Portuguese companies or being their biggest shareholder is by Anabela Campos and Isabel Vicente
3. Very recently, it was announced the establishment of a factory around Sines of  electric vehicles lithium batteries by a Chinese company, namely,China Aviation Lithium Battery Technology (CALB)
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: Portugal was one of the 57 founding members of AIIB. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: The Portugal – Hong Kong Chamber of Commerce and Industry (PHKCCI) is a member of the Belt and Road Global Forum. While it could be debated whether this is a major business or not, it is formally integrated into the Belt and Road. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.note: In Portugal, there are several business associations that deal with trade relations with China such as Luso-Chinese Chamber of Industry and Commerce and the Portugal-China Young Entrepreneus Association, but none are specifically integrated into the Belt and Road Initiative.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: One financial institution, namely, Bison Bank is included in CIPS.  It is not one of the major finantial institutions but it meets the formal criterion for this indicator. Therefore, ths indicator deserves a "Yes" response.

Technology.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Technology.note: There main licensed telecom service providers are MEO, NOS, NOWO and Vodafone.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: One of the key players regarding hardware 5G cellular networks  was/is Huawei.  But in 2023 the Portuguese Cyberspace Security High Council issued a deliberation excluding 5G suppliers that do not belong to the EU, NATO or OECD countries (article 5 b).  Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating.  Taking into account the fact that Huawei was highly used and that the telecom operators are now working on how to meet this compulsory deliberation the fact remains that Huawei is still important. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Significant" Rating.
Technology.note: Since the deliberation is compulsory the 5G infrastructure is a case to watch in 2024. Huawei has appealed against the decision in court: https://eco.sapo.pt/2023/09/04/huawei-portugal-impugna-em-tribunal-exclusao-do-5g/
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: One of the key players regarding Wifi or fiber/broadband networks was/is Huawei. But in 2023 the Portuguese Cyberspace Security High Council issued a deliberation excluding 5G suppliers that do not belong to the EU, NATO or OCDE countries (article 5 b). The telecom operators are now working on how to meet this compulsory deliberation. Therefore, the Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Moreover, given the  fact that thus Chinese companhy was/is very strong in the routers for Wi-Fi and the work to replace them is still ongoing, the fact remains that it is still significant. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Portugal has become a hub of fiber optic cables, particularly subsea. There is the submarine cable in the Azores (see China map in link 1) that was delivered by Huawei Marine, and then was sold to another Chinese company HMN tech (see link n. 2). Since then, the major submarine cables are not Chinese (see link n. 1). However, it does not seem to make sense to include the Azorean case as a «major» project, despite the fact that it is Portuguese territory and being an archipelago increases its vulnerability. Moreover, the new 5G legislation (excluiding Chinese companies) shows a tendency to protect critical infrastructures and there isn't any major project to be built in the future by Chinese companies. In point of fact, the most recent deal is by Google.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "No" response.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There are some cases of Portuguese technology start-ups such as the unicorn "Farfetch" that started with investment by Tencent (and in its Chinese operation with Alibaba).Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Nonetheless, the most recent news reveal that Farfetch is struggling and there are huge doubts about its future. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: An organization called “葡萄牙中国和平统一促进会(Portuguese Association for the Promotion of Peaceful Reunification of China)” exists. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Nonetheless, its activities are far from having an impact in society. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.

Society.evidence: In the official programme of CGTP (one of the two bigger union platforms) regarding 2024-2028 it is stated that "it will give special attention in Asia to the Federation of Trade Unions of China (...)". This linkage is not new (see the example of 2011). To which extent this linkage between one of the Portuguese trade union platforms and its Chinese counterpart is relevant or has an impact remains to be seen. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Society.note: In the original language: "5.4.14. A CGTP-IN defende a existência de relações bilaterais com centrais de todos os continentes e a participação em múltiplos espaços multilaterais. A CGTP-IN propõe-se a a continuar a desenvolver acções diversificadas de cooperação com organizações sindicais de diversos continentes, nomeadamente a cooperação para o desenvolvimento, com destaque para os países de língua oficial Portuguesa. A CGTP-IN dá importância à recuperação da actividade da Comunidade Sindical dos Países de Língua Portuguesa (CSPLP) e estará empenhada na sua intervenção. Dará especial atenção ao continente africano e às relações com a COSATU (Africa do Sul) e a OUSA; na América Latina às centrais sindicais do Brasil, Cuba, Venezuela, Uruguai, Chile, Colômbia, Nicarágua, Bolívia entre outras; na Ásia à central sindical da China e à do Vietname e ao movimento sindical japonês e às centrais sindicais da Índia; no Médio Oriente à Palestina, à Síria, ao Líbano, à Confederação Internacional dos Sindicatos Árabes"
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is an historical Macau community in Portugal, which has a plethora of associations.  This community through its cultural associations such as Casa Macau organises some cultural events. The PRC Embassy  also promotes these cultural events. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Notwithstanding, these events do not have a major impact in society. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Society.note: Other associations include e. g.  "Liga da Multissecular Amizade Portugal - China" or the Fundação Jorge Álvares. See, for instance, the following document in which several associations are included. Some of them are, to the best of our knowledge, unknown or almost unkown:https://ccpc-pme.pt/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/CCPME-Lista-de-Cartas-de-Felicitac%CC%A7o%CC%83es_%E8%B4%BA%E4%BF%A1%E5%90%8D%E5%BD%95.pdf
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence:
“葡萄牙中华妇女联合总会(The Chinese Women's Federation of Portugal)” reportedly exists and aims to advance Chinese culture, engaging in charitable endeavors, and encouraging collaboration and exchanges between Chinese and Portuguese women.
However, it is far from clear that they are closely engaged with their local counterparts, nor is it clear how active they are at all. Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There are several cases of cooperation with China on entertainment products. Therefore this Indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. Nonetheless, their impact seems to be so far rather circumscribed. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: In Portugal, Tik Tok is very popular particularly amongst the younger generations. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There are several cultural exchange projects and cultural events. Most of them are carried out by the Chinese embassy in Portugal and/or the Macau Scientific and Cultural Centre. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. However, their impact on the broader society is limited. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Society.note: The latest «Transatlantic Survey» coordinated by the German Marshall Fund presents a negative perception in 2023 by the majority of those who were included in this survey (public at large and not elites). To the question "How do you feel about China’s influence in global affairs?" 60% of the Portuguese have responded negatively (61% in 2022). Moreover, when asked «Would you still want your country to be tougher on China even if this had a negative impact in your country's economy?» 51% said yes whilst 29% said no.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is an extradition treaty regarding Portugal and China, but not for e.g. capital offences, life sentences or crimes of a political nature. Only if there are assurances from China these punishments will not be applied. Even so, there is controversy because of concerns regarding rule of law in China. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Law Enforcement.note: For the criticism see: https://observador.pt/2022/10/04/depois-do-caso-das-esquadras-il-insiste-em-pedir-suspensao-do-acordo-de-extradicao-entre-portugal-e-hong-kong/  (from the political party IL (Liberal Initiative]) + https://www.tsf.pt/mundo/portugal-deveria-abandonar-pacto-de-extradicao-com-hong-kong-alerta-ativista-exilado-16637353.html
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Law Enforcement.note: Wihin the 17 agreements signed in 2018, there was a general point on the need for greater cooperation regarding financing of terrorism and fighting terrorism. But, to the best of my knowledge, this general statement did not evolve into a specific cooperation agreement entailing law enforcement authorities. In fact, the cooperation is towards the EU and the USA.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There have been public cases in which there is acknowledgment of the active presence of the «Chinese Mafia» iin Portugal. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Law Enforcement.note: The case of Macau, which has de jure a 50 years Portuguese Rule of Law, is of course different. Since the survey focuses on Portugal I have not included the special case of Macau with exception to answer #7 because it deals with Portuguese citizens.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Law Enforcement.note: Although the country being analysed is Portugal, it is important to note the special case of Macau, in which Portuguese Rule of Law was supposed to apply until 2049. Unfortunately, reality has proven otherwise. This is relevant for the many Portuguese citizens living in Macau. There have been instances in Macau of Portuguese lawyers, for instance, who have been targeted and are subject to intimidation. The case of lawyer Jorge Menezes is, unfortunately, a good example of this reality.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: Cyber attacks focusing on intelligence or industrial/economic espionage have increased. Nonetheless, while the threat from China is acknowledged and recognized, firm evidence cannot be provided. Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: Following the investigation published by Safeguard Defenders in 2022 regarding this topic and which indicated 3 of these 'Overseas police stations' in Lisbon, Oporto and Madeira (1st link), the Minister of Foreign Affairs asked the PRC for guarantees that this was not the case. These guarantees came through in mid-2023 (link nº 3). Meanwhile, due to the seriuosness of the allegations, a decision was made to start a public judicial investigation into this matter, which is still ongoing (link nº 2). The  ongoing investigations have not (yet) confirmed that these were 'police stations' rather than 'sevice centres' as claimed by the PRC authorities. Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator could not be provided.
Law Enforcement.note: This is an indicator to follow closely throughout 2024.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Law Enforcement.note: On the contrary, the concerns of Portugal are regarding citizens who have both Portuguese and Chinese citizenship, either detained in Hong Kong or fleeing to Taiwan as the cases of  Kin Chung Wong (2022) and Tsz Lun Ko (2020) show.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: Extraditions from Portugal to PRC do occur, even if they are not large in number. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Law Enforcement.note: Portugal has finished in 2023 the guidelines for the use of body cameras by its Police. The public procurement for suppliers will be reopened in 2024.
